message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest bacterial meningitis, and the decreased glucose concentration in CSF indicates bacterial infection. Among the options, encapsulated, gram-positive cocci in pairs are the most common cause of bacterial meningitis in adults, usually Streptococcus pneumoniae.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and CSF findings suggest bacterial meningitis, which is often caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae, an encapsulated gram-positive cocci in pairs. The other options are less common causes of bacterial meningitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of fever, headache, nausea and vomiting, and severe neck rigidity suggest meningitis. Gram-positive bacteria are the most common cause of meningitis, and among the options, only encapsulated, gram-positive cocci in pairs are commonly associated with meningitis.
